comment.author: 32841182@N07
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called FILM., and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 11527381@N00
comment._content:
I want to thank you for scanning and making these images available. 
they are wonderful to ponder, and it is a comfort to know they are available beyond the walls of the Library and the rooms and drawers where they are stabilized for posterity.  

it's surely a monumental task, and you are doing it right.   

-k

comment._content: I like the two sailors just chillin’ in that lifeboat at the right.

comment.author: 55961052@N00
comment._content: I love ships named after landlocked places.

comment.author: 8683355@N07
comment._content:
Well it is a state within a country that is not landlocked, and they do have representation in Congress which is the body that declares war. 

This is a nice photo!

comment.author: 69833347@N00
comment._content:
I think there is more people in that photo than live in the actual state of Wyoming.

Love the dudes in the lifeboat.

comment.author: 83025347@N00
comment._content:
Wyoming was commissioned 25 September 1912 so this was taken after that date.

The Wyoming was in NYC May 28-31 1913 for the dedication of the Maine Monument. I'm guessing this was taken at that time since the negative numbers are very close, all are 2694-x. Do your records indicate any kind of system for the negative numbers? It might help date some of the other photos if, for example, the numbers were assigned in sequence, and therefore go up in chronological order.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT on May 25, 1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9A01E2D8103BE633A... indicates that the Wyoming led the fleet during the unveiling ceremonies for the Maine monument. Every dreadnought and superdreadnought in the fleet was to be in the fleet. The Hudson must have been quite a sight.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Yes, there is a general chronological order to the call numbers, but it's not always totally reliable in this collection. That said, it does appear likely this is related to the Maine ceremonies--especially with the additional news evidence.  We'll add the correct date to the record and reload the description.  Thanks!

comment.author: 22692205@N00
comment._content: I get the feeling that they asked for volunteers and everyone but that one clueless guy took a step back.

comment.author: 38085324@N02
comment._content: The Marine's always seem to represent the epitomy of respect and self-service through their pictures alone.
